Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether removal can be stayed due to delayed PRRA decision and potential harm in Pakistan
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed delayed PRRA communication and changed country conditions in Pakistan, particularly violence against Shias
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending further review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No serious issue to be tried or irreparable harm demonstrated
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failure to depart after visa expiry and subsequent illegal presence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Delayed PRRA decision and fear of harm based on religious profile in Pakistan
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Speculative nature of harm and lack of new evidence
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to PRRA and removal orders
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness and correctness, depending on legal question
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claimed risk deemed speculative and not sufficiently substantiated
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA decision, country condition reports, applicant's submissions
Crimes.Application_Basis: Alleged procedural unfairness and humanitarian concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of compelling new evidence showing personal risk
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Federal Court evaluates stay applications based on three-part test
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of individualized risk or changed circumstances
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential harm in Pakistan considered speculative
Crimes.Cause_Description: Delayed PRRA decision and concerns over safety due to Shia faith
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court found prior decisions adequately considered available evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 112(1) of IRPA – failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborative or updated evidence on personal risk
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – overstayed visa and remained after PRRA refusal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No material change in country conditions proven
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No new evidence to justify reopening; harm claim self-inflicted
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide fresh, compelling evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Three-part test for stay: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether removal should be stayed due to delayed PRRA and alleged risk upon return
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Prior decisions binding; no new evidence presented
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate irreparable harm and serious issue
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Claims of harm viewed as speculative and self-created
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Issue estoppel applies where claims were previously rejected
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for factual findings, correctness for jurisdictional questions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution in Pakistan due to religious identity
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No merit found in stay application
Crimes.Review_Standard: Stay applications assessed on balance of convenience and irreparable harm
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Delay noted but not found to amount to unfairness
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: PRRA decision, country condition reports, past IRB rulings
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA framework for PRRA and removal orders
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Delay in PRRA notification and risk upon return
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for factual assertions
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Enforcement of removal order by CBSA
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, government reports, legal arguments
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Suspension of removal pending further proceedings
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national with final removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Overstaying visa and failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Pre-removal risk assessment and judicial review
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court – immigration and refugee matters
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Three-part test for stay applications; issue estoppel
